text: Jesa (Korean: 제사; Hanja: 祭祀, ) is a ceremony commonly practiced in Korea. Jesa helps people celebrate their ancestors. Jesa are usually held on the anniversary of the ancestor's death. Most people participate in Jesa but some religious groups such as Protestants and Muslims do not. 지금은 다른 종교를 믿을 수 있기 때문에 굳이 제사를 통해 영생을 찾을 필요도 없다. 개신교에서는 제사 대신 추도예배를 드린다 The Catholic Church permitted Jisi in 1939.
